VICTINI.description:
This Pokémon brings victory.
It is said that Trainers with Victini
always win, regardless of the type
of encounter.

SNIVY.description:
It is very intelligent and calm.
Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes
its movements swifter. When they are
not feeling well, their tails droop.

SERVINE.description:
When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be
used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps
clean. They avoid attacks by sinking into
the shadows of thick foliage.

SERPERIOR.description:
They raise their heads to intimidate foes,
but only give it their all when fighting
powerful opponents who are not fazed
by the glare from its noble eyes.

TEPIG.description:
It loves to eat roasted berries, but
sometimes it gets too excited and burns
them to a crisp. It blows fire through
its nose.

PIGNITE.description:
The more it eats, the more fuel it has
to make the fire in its stomach stronger.
When it is angered, the intensity of the
flame increases.

EMBOAR.description:
It is adept at using many different moves.
It can throw a fire punch by setting its
fists on fire with its fiery chin.
It cares deeply about its friends.

MEGA.description:
Brandishing a blazing flame
shaped like a serpentine spear,
it rushes in to save its
imperiled allies.

OSHAWOTT.description:
The scalchop on its stomach isn't just
used for battle, it can be used to break
open hard berries as well. It is made
from the same element as its claws.

DEWOTT.description:
Strict training and disclipine leads it
to master its flowing double-scalchop
technique. Scalchop techniques differ
from one Dewott to another.

SAMUROTT.description:
One swing of the seamitars attached
to its armor can fell an opponent.
A simple glare from one of them is
enough to intimidate most enemies.

HISUI.description:
Hard of heart and deft of blade,
this rare form of Samurott is a
product of the Pokémon's evolution in the
region of Hisui.

PATRAT.description:
Extremely cautious, they take shifts to
maintain a constant watch of their nest.
Using food stored in cheek pouches,
they can keep watch for days.

WATCHOG.description:
Using luminescent matter, it makes its
eyes and body glow and stuns attacking
opponents. Keen eyesight lets them see
in the dark.

LILLIPUP.description:
It faces strong opponents with great
courage. Because it doesn't yelp, it's
extremely popular with Trainers who live
in apartment buildings.

HERDIER.description:
Its dense black fur grows continuously.
The high cost of keeping its hard fur
properly groomed makes this a
troublesome Pokémon to train.

STOUTLAND.description:
Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant,
there could be no concern that it would
ever attack people. Some parents even
trust it to babysit.

PURRLOIN.description:
Their deceptively cute act is the
perfect ruse. They steal from people for
fun, but their victims can't help but
forgive them.

LIEPARD.description:
Many Trainers are drawn to their
beautiful form and fur. These Pokémon
vanish and appear unexpectedly.
They run silently in the night.

PANSAGE.description:
This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest.
It's good at finding berries and gathers
them from all over. It's kind enough to
share them with friends.

SIMISAGE.description:
Ill tempered, it attacks enemies by
swinging its barbed tail around wildly.
The leaf growing on its head is
very bitter.

PANSEAR.description:
The fire within the tuft on its head can
reach up to 600ºF. Very intelligent,
it roasts berries before eating them.
It likes to help people.

SIMISEAR.description:
It loves sweets because they become
energy for the fire burning inside its
body. It scatters embers from its head
and tail to sear its opponents.

PANPOUR.description:
The water stored inside the tuft of its
head is rich in nutrients. It waters
plants using its tail, plants that
receive its water grow large.

SIMIPOUR.description:
It can shoot highly-pressurised water
from its tail with enough power to
break through a solid concrete wall.
It prefers places with clean water.

MUNNA.description:
This Pokémon appears before people
and Pokémon who are having nightmares
and eats those dreams. Munna always
float in the air.

MUSHARNA.description:
The mist emanating from their foreheads
is packed with the dreams of people and
Pokémon. It changes into different colors
depending on the dream that was eaten.

PIDOVE.description:
This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for
a new order from its Trainer even though
it already has one. Flocks often gather
in parks and plazas.

TRANQUILL.description:
No matter where in the world it goes,
it knows where its nest is, so it can
always return to its Trainer's location
regardless of the distance.

UNFEZANT.description:
Males have plumage on their heads.
The females' flying abilities surpass
those of the males. They will only let
themselves feel close to their Trainers.

BLITZLE.description:
Its mane shines when it discharges
electricity. They use the frequency and
rhythm of these flashes to communicate
with one another.

ZEBSTRIKA.description:
When Zebstrika run at full speed, the
sound of thunder reverberates. It is
dangerous when it's angry as it shoots
lightning from its mane in all directions.

ROGGENROLA.description:
The hexagonal cavity is its ear.
It walks in the direction of sounds it
hears, but if the sounds cease, it panics
and topples over.

BOLDORE.description:
Its orange crystal is a mass of energy.
Just one crystal fragment would provide
enough fuel for a hundred dump trucks.
When it is healthy, its core sticks out.

GIGALITH.description:
The blasts of energy it makes from
sunbeams have terrifying power.
However, it's not able to fire its blasts
at night or on rainy days.

WOOBAT.description:
Its habitat is dark forests and caves.
Suction from its nostrils enables it
to stick to cave walls during sleep.
It leaves a heart-shaped mark behind.

SWOOBAT.description:
Anyone who comes into contact with
the ultrasonic waves emitted by a
courting male experiences a positive
mood shift.

DRILBUR.description:
It can dig through the ground at a
speed of 30 mph by spinning its body.
It could give a car running aboveground
a good race.

EXCADRILL.description:
More than 300 feet below the surface,
they build mazelike nests. Their activity
can be destructive to subway tunnels,
but it can also help with construction.

MEGA.description:
If this Pokémon brings its arms and
head together to form a streamlined
shape and spins at high speeds,
it can destroy anything.

AUDINO.description:
Its auditory sense is astounding.
Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell
how someone is feeling or when an egg
might hatch.

MEGA.description:
Mega Audino emits a soothing pulse from
its body that reduces hostility in others.
Anything that comes into contact with its
second feelers will fall into a deep sleep.

TIMBURR.description:
These Pokémon appear at building
sites and help out with construction.
They always carry squared logs.
As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

GURDURR.description:
They strengthen their bodies by carrying
steel beams. This Pokémon is so muscular
and strongly built that even a group of
wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

CONKELDURR.description:
They use concrete pillars as walking
canes. Rather than rely solely on force,
they master moves that utilize the
centrifugal force of spinning concrete.

TYMPOLE.description:
By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound
waves imperceptible to humans. It uses
the rhythm of these sounds to talk and
warns others of danger.

PALPITOAD.description:
It lives in the water and on land.
When they vibrate the bumps on their
heads, they can make waves in water
or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

SEISMITOAD.description:
It increases the power of its punches
by vibrating the bumps on its fists.
They can also shoot paralyzing liquid
from their head bumps.

THROH.description:
When it tightens its belt, it becomes
stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave
their own belts. It changes belts as it
gets more powerful.

SAWK.description:
The sound of Sawk punching boulders
and trees can be heard all the way from
the mountains where they train.
Disturbing their training angers them.

SEWADDLE.description:
It chews up leaves and sews them with
sticky thread extruded from its mouth.
Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes,
it is a mascot for fashion designers.

SWADLOON.description:
Forests where Swadloon live have
superb foliage because the nutrients
they make from fallen leaves nourish
the plant life.

LEAVANNY.description:
It keeps its eggs warm with heat from
fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to
weave warm wrappings for Sewaddle by
using the silk secreted from its mouth.

VENIPEDE.description:
Using the feelers on its head and tail,
it picks up vibrations in the air to
determine its prey's location and state.
It is brutally aggressive.

WHIRLIPEDE.description:
Storing energy for evolution, it sits.
But when attacked, it spins its body at
high speed like a wheel and then
crashes furiously into its opponent.

SCOLIPEDE.description:
With quick movements, it chases down
its foes, attacking relentlessly with its
horns until it prevails. Then it finishes
them off with deadly poison.

MEGA.description: Its deadly venom gives off a faint\nglow. The venom affects Scolipede's\nmind, honing its viciousness.

COTTONEE.description:
When it finds others of its kind, they all
stick together. When enough of them
have collected, the mass resembles a
cumulonimbus cloud.

WHIMSICOTT.description:
It rides on the wind and slips into
people's homes. After it has turned a
room into a cotton-filled mess, it giggles
to itself and takes off.

PETILIL.description:
By pruning the leaves on its head with
regularity, this Pokémon can be grown
into a fine plump shape. These bitter
leaves refresh those who eat them.

LILLIGANT.description:
Even veteran Trainers face a challenge
in getting its beautiful flower to bloom.
It withers away if a trainer does not
take good care of it.

HISUI.description:
Its well-developed legs are the result of
a life spent on mountains covered in deep
snow. The scent it exudes from its flower
crown heartens those in proximity.

BASCULIN_RED_STRIPED.description:
It used to be a common food source. The
meat of red Basculin is on the fatty side
and it's more popular with the youth.
Its temperament is vicious and aggressive.

BASCULIN_BLUE_STRIPED.description:
They form schools with others of the same
color. The greatest foe of a school of blue
Basculin is a school of red Basculin.
Its flavor is light and inoffensive.

BASCULIN_WHITE_STRIPED.description:
While this ancient form of Basculin shares
a vast array of qualities with other forms,
it differs in several respects, including
demeanor, being much gentler than others.

BASCULEGION_F.description: The souls of its comrades cloak its\nbody and propel it effortlessly\nthrough even raging rapids.

BASCULEGION_M.description:
Clads itself in the souls of comrades that
perished before fulfilling their goals of
journeying upstream. No other species in
all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.

SANDILE.description:
It conceals itself in the sand and
chomps down on the legs of any prey
that unwarily walk over it. Its favorite
food is Trapinch.

KROKOROK.description:
They move in groups of a few individuals.
Thanks to the special membrane covering
its eyes, it can see its surroundings
clearly, even in the dead of night.

KROOKODILE.description:
Very violent Pokémon, they never allow
their prey to escape. Their jaws are so
powerful, they can crush the body of
an automobile.

DARUMAKA.description:
When its internal fire is burning, it
cannot calm down and it runs around.
When the fire diminishes, it pulls its
limbs into its body and falls asleep.

GALAR.description:
The colder they get, the more
energetic they are. They freeze their
breath to make snowballs, using them
as ammo for playful snowball fights.

DARMANITAN_ZEN.description: When wounded, it stops moving. It\ngoes as still as stone to meditate,\nsharpening its mind and spirit.

DARMANITAN_STANDARD.description:
When one is injured in a fierce battle,
it transforms into a stone statue.
Then it meditates and sharpens its
mind and fights on mentally.

DARMANITAN_GALAR_STANDARD.description:
On days when blizzards blow
through, it comes down to where people
live. It stashes food in the snowball on
its head, taking it home for later.

DARMANITAN_GALAR_ZEN.description:
Darmanitan takes this form when
enraged. It won't stop spewing flames
until its rage has settled, even if
its body starts to melt.

MARACTUS.description:
Arid regions are their habitat.
When it moves rhythmically, it makes a
sound similar to maracas, making the
surprised Pokémon flee.

DWEBBLE.description:
It makes a hole in a stone of a suitable
size. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon
remains agitated until it locates
a replacement.

CRUSTLE.description:
Competing for territory, Crustle fight
viciously. The one whose boulder is
broken is the loser of the battle and
begins to weaken.

SCRAGGY.description:
Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it
can reduce damage by defensively
pulling its skin up to its neck.
Its skull is massively thick.

SCRAFTY.description:
Groups of them beat up anything that
enters their territory. The one with the
biggest crest is the group leader, and
is the most respected.

MEGA.description:
Mega Evolution has caused Scrafty's
shed skin to turn white, growing
tough and supple. Of course, this
Pokémon is still as feisty as ever.

SIGILYPH.description:
The guardians of an ancient city, they
always fly the same route while keeping
watch for invaders. They use their
psychic power to attack enemies.

YAMASK.description:
These Pokémon arose from the spirits
of people interred in graves in past ages.
Each of them carries a mask that used
to be its face when it was human.

GALAR.description:
A clay slab with cursed engravings
took possession of a Yamask. The
slab is said to be absorbing the
Yamask's dark power.

COFAGRIGUS.description:
Grave robbers who mistake them for
real coffins and get too close end up
trapped inside their bodies. Their bodies
are covered in pure gold.

RUNERIGUS.description: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient\npainting. After absorbing the spirit of\na Yamask, the painting began to move.

TIRTOUGA.description:
Reputed to be the ancestor of most
turtle Pokémon, it lived in warm seas
about a hundred million years ago.
It was restored from a fossil.

CARRACOSTA.description:
They can live both in the ocean and
on land. Incredible jaw strength enables
them to chew up steel beams and rocks
along with their prey.

ARCHEN.description:
Said to be the ancestor of all bird
Pokémon, Archen itself could not actually
fly but moved by hopping from treetop
to treetop.

ARCHEOPS.description:
They are intelligent and will cooperate
to catch prey. When one Archeops
had the prey cornered, another would
swoop on it.

TRUBBISH.description:
It gorges on trash until its stomach
is full. Then it belches toxic gas.
An unlucky whiff of this gas will put
a person in the hospital.

GARBODOR.description:
Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots
from its right arm. If even a little of it
gets on you, you'll experience the full
effects of this unidentified toxin.

GMAX.description:
It sprays toxic gas from its mouth
and fingers. If the gas engulfs you,
the toxins will seep in all the way
down to your bones.

ZORUA.description:
To protect themselves from danger, they
hide their true identities by transforming
into people and Pokémon. Apparently, it
often transforms into a silent child.

HISUI.description:
Derives power from resentment,
which rises as energy atop its head and
takes on the forms of foes. In this
way, Zorua vents lingering malice.

ZOROARK.description:
Bonds between these Pokémon are very
strong. It protects the safety of its
pack by tricking its opponents. They
defend their lair with illusory scenery.

HISUI.description:
Heedless of its own safety,
Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter
energy so intense, it lacerates
Zoroark's own body.

MINCCINO.description:
These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat.
They greet one another by rubbing each
other with their tails, which are always
kept well groomed and clean.

CINCCINO.description:
Their white fur feels amazing to touch.
Cinccino's body is coated in a special
oil that repels dust and helps it deflect
attacks, such as punches.

GOTHITA.description:
They intently observe both Trainers and
Pokémon. Apparently, Gothita are looking
at something that only they can see. Their
ribbonlike feelers increase their power.

GOTHORITA.description:
Starlight is the source of their power.
They use hypnosis to control people and
Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading them
astray are told in every corner.

GOTHITELLE.description:
Starry skies thousands of light-years
away are visible in the space distorted by
their intense psychic power. When it learns
its Trainer's life span, it cries in sadness.

SOLOSIS.description:
Because their bodies are enveloped
in a special liquid, they are fine in any
environment, no matter how severe. They
can use telepathy to talk with others.

DUOSION.description:
When their brains, now divided in two,
are thinking the same thoughts,
these Pokémon exhibit their maximized
psychic power.

REUNICLUS.description:
They use psychic power to control their
arms, which are made of a special liquid.
When Reuniclus shake hands, a network
forms between their brains.

DUCKLETT.description:
These bird Pokémon are excellent divers.
They are better at swimming than flying,
and they happily eat their favorite food,
peat moss, as they dive underwater.

SWANNA.description:
Despite their elegant appearance, they
can flap their wings strongly and fly for
thousands of miles. The one in the middle
is the leader of the flock.

VANILLITE.description:
The temperature of their breath is -58ºF.
They create snow crystals and make snow
fall in the areas around them. Vanillite is
treasured by households in warm regions.

VANILLISH.description:
Vanillish has existed since the Ice Age.
It controls particles of ice, freezes its
opponents, and then shatters them with
a headbutt.

VANILLUXE.description:
Each of its two heads has a brain, and
when they are in agreement, it attacks
its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard.
It makes snow clouds inside its body.

DEERLING_AUTUMN.description:
Deerling have different scents
depending on the season. In this form,
Deerling have a softly sweet scent
that lingers in the nose.

DEERLING_SPRING.description:
Deerling have different scents
depending on the season. In early
spring, these Pokémon give off a
delicate, sweet, and calming scent.

DEERLING_SUMMER.description:
To prevent Deerling from entering
their fields, many farmers will have
several Lycanroc stand guard, as
they are its natural enemy.

DEERLING_WINTER.description:
Deerling's scent changes with the
seasons, but when the Pokémon is in
its Winter Form, it has hardly any
scent at all.

SAWSBUCK_AUTUMN.description:
Sawsbuck in their Autumn Form are
known for having very short
tempers. The males fight each other
incessantly.

SAWSBUCK_SPRING.description:
Some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers
of spring because the plants growing on
its horns change according to the season.
The leader possesses magnificent horns.

SAWSBUCK_SUMMER.description:
The thicker and larger the
branches and leaves on its antlers, the
more majestic the Sawsbuck is thought
to be.

SAWSBUCK_WINTER.description:
Though there are many enthusiasts
for Sawsbuck as a species, this
seasonal form in particular is not
very popular.

EMOLGA.description:
It glides using its cape-like membrane.
It grills berries and bug Pokémon with
electric shocks from the pouches on its
cheeks and makes a meal of them.

KARRABLAST.description:
When they feel threatened, they spit an
acidic liquid to drive attackers away.
For some reason they evolve while they
are in the same place as Shelmet.

ESCAVALIER.description:
Wearing the shell covering they stole
from Shelmet, they defend themselves and
attack with two lances. The steel armor
protects their whole body.

FOONGUS.description:
It lures Pokémon in with its pattern that
looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases
its poison spores. Why it resembles a
Poké Ball is unknown.

AMOONGUSS.description:
It lures prey close by dancing and waving
its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls,
in a swaying motion, but very few Pokémon
are fooled by this.

FRILLISH.description:
If its veil-like arms stun and wrap an
opponent, that foe will be dragged
five miles below the surface to its lair,
never to return.

JELLICENT.description:
They propel themselves by expelling
absorbed seawater from their bodies.
It's said there's a castle of ships
Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.

ALOMOMOLA.description:
When they find a wounded Pokémon,
they embrace it and bring it to shore.
The special membrane enveloping
Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.

JOLTIK.description:
Since they can't generate their own
electricity, they attach themselves to
large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static
electricity, which they store in a pouch.

GALVANTULA.description:
It creates barriers from electrified silk
that stun foes. This works as a weapon as
well as a defense. While it is immobilized
by shock, they leisurely consume it.

FERROSEED.description:
It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock
while clinging to the ceiling of caves.
When threatened, it attacks by shooting
a barrage of spikes.

FERROTHORN.description:
It fights by swinging around its three
spiky feelers and shooting spikes.
A hit from these steel spikes can reduce
a boulder to rubble.

KLINK.description:
Two bodies comprise a fixed pair.
The two minigears that mesh together
are predetermined. Each will rebound from
other minigears without meshing.

KLANG.description:
A minigear and big gear comprise its
body. Spinning minigears are rotated
at high speed and repeatedly fired away.
It is dangerous if the gears don't return.

KLINKLANG.description:
Its red core functions as an energy tank.
It is rotated at high speed for a rapid
energy charge. It fires the charged energy
through its spikes into an area.

TYNAMO.description:
These Pokémon move in schools.
One alone can emit only a trickle of
electricity, so a group of them gathers
to unleash a powerful electric shock.

EELEKTRIK.description:
These Pokémon have a big appetite.
It wraps itself around its prey and
paralyzes it with electricity from the
round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

EELEKTROSS.description:
They crawl out of the ocean using their
arms. They will attack prey on shore and
immediately drag it into the ocean, with
their sucker mouths.

MEGA.description:
It now generates 10 times the
electricity it did before Mega
Evolving. It discharges this energy
from its false Eelektrik made of mucus.

ELGYEM.description:
It psychically squeezes the brain of
its foe, causing unendurable headaches.
Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO
crash site in the desert 50 years ago.

BEHEEYEM.description:
It can manipulate an opponent's memory.
Apparently, it communicates by flashing
its three fingers, but those patterns
haven't been decoded.

LITWICK.description:
While Litwick shines a light and pretends
to be a guide, it absorbs the life force of
any who follow it, which becomes the fuel
that it burns.

LAMPENT.description:
This ominous Pokémon is feared.
Through cities it wanders, searching
for the spirits of the fallen. The spirits
it absorbs fuel its baleful fire.

CHANDELURE.description:
Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns
up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
By waving the flames on its arms, it puts
its foes into a hypnotic trance.

MEGA.description:
One of its eyes is a window linking
our world with the afterlife.
This Pokémon draws in hatred and
converts it into power.

AXEW.description:
They mark their territory by leaving
gashes in trees with their tusks. If a
tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly,
harder and sturdier than the last.

FRAXURE.description:
Their tusks can shatter rocks.
A broken tusk will not grow back,
so it diligently sharpens its tusks on
river rocks after the end of a battle.

HAXORUS.description:
They are kind but can be relentless
when defending territory. Their sturdy
tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut
steel beams.

CUBCHOO.description:
Its nose is always running.
Their snot is a barometer of health.
When healthy, their snot is sticky and
the power of their ice moves increases.

BEARTIC.description:
It freezes its breath to create fangs
and claws of ice to fight with.
Very able in the water, it swims around
in northern seas and catches prey.

CRYOGONAL.description:
They are born in snow clouds. When
its body temperature goes up, it turns
into steam and vanishes. When its
temperature lowers, it returns to ice.

SHELMET.description:
When attacked, it defends itself by
closing the lid of its shell. It evolves
when bathed in an electric-like energy
along with Karrablast.

ACCELGOR.description:
When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to
prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in
layers of thin membrane. It is very light
and fights with ninja-like movements.

STUNFISK.description:
It conceals itself in the mud of the
seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch
it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.
It smiles when transmitting electricity.

GALAR.description:
Its conspicuous lips lure prey in
as it lies in wait in the mud. When
prey gets close, Stunfisk clamps its
jagged steel fins down on them.

MIENFOO.description:
They have mastered elegant combos.
As they concentrate, their battle moves
become swifter and more precise. What it
lacks in power, it makes up for in quantity.

MIENSHAO.description:
They use the long fur on their arms as
a whip to strike their opponents. Its arm
attacks come with such rapidity that they
cannot even be seen.

DRUDDIGON.description:
It warms its body by absorbing sunlight
with its wings. When its body temperature
falls, it can no longer move. It uses its
sharp claws to catch prey.

GOLETT.description:
These Pokémon are thought to have
been created by the science of an
ancient and mysterious civilization.
It's been active for thousands of years.

GOLURK.description:
Golurk were created to protect people
and Pokémon by an ancient civilisation.
Removing the seal on its chest makes its
internal energy go out of control.

PAWNIARD.description:
Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by
sinking the blades that cover their bodies
into their prey. If battling dulls them, it
sharpens them on stones by the river.

BISHARP.description:
This pitiless Pokémon commands a group
of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility.
It battles to become the boss, but will be
driven from the group if it loses.

evolutions.raw:
#if P_GEN_9_CROSS_EVOS
EVOLUTION({EVO_LEVEL, 0, SPECIES_KINGAMBIT, CONDITIONS({IF_DEFEAT_X_WITH_ITEMS, SPECIES_BISHARP, ITEM_LEADERS_CREST, 3})})
#endif

KINGAMBIT.description:
Though it commands a massive army
in battle, it's not skilled at
devising complex strategies. It just uses
brute strength to keep pushing.

BOUFFALANT.description:
Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even
if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
Their headbutts have enough destructive
force to derail a train.

RUFFLET.description:
With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces
its prey, and then it pecks at them.
Although it also consumes berries, it's a
carnivore at heart.

BRAVIARY.description:
For the sake of its friends, this brave
warrior of the sky will not stop battling,
even if it is injured. One can carry a car
while flying.

HISUI.description: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle\ncry, this huge and ferocious bird\nPokémon goes out on the hunt.

VULLABY.description:
It can't fly yet and must wait until its
wings have developed more. They guard
their posteriors with bones that were
gathered by Mandibuzz.

MANDIBUZZ.description:
They adorn themselves beautifully with
bones. This is supposedly an effort to
attract males, but no male Mandibuzz
have ever been found.

HEATMOR.description:
It draws in air through its tail,
transforms it into fire, and uses it like
a tongue. They burn through Durant's steel
bodies and consume their insides.

DURANT.description:
Durant dig nests in mountains.
Individuals each play different roles in
driving Heatmor, their natural predator,
away from their colony.

DEINO.description:
Lacking sight, it's unaware of its
surroundings, so it bumps into things and
eats anything that moves. Approaching
it carelessly is dangerous.

ZWEILOUS.description:
After it has eaten up all the food in its
territory, it moves on to another area.
Whichever head eats more than the other
gets to be the leader.

HYDREIGON.description:
This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on
its six wings. The heads on their arms do
not have brains. They use all three heads
to consume and destroy everything.

LARVESTA.description:
This Pokémon was believed to have
been born from the sun. It spews fire from
its horns and encases itself in a cocoon
of fire when it evolves.

VOLCARONA.description:
When volcanic ash darkened the
atmosphere, it appeared and saved Pokémon
from freezing, Volcarona's fire provided a
replacement for the sun.

COBALION.description:
It has a body and heart of steel. This
legendary Pokémon battled against humans
to protect Pokémon. Its personality
is calm and composed.

TERRAKION.description:
Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used
its phenomenal power to destroy a castle
in its effort to protect Pokémon that had
lost their homes in a war among humans.

VIRIZION.description:
Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades.
Legends say this Pokémon used
whirlwind-like movements to confound
and swiftly cut its opponents.

TORNADUS_THERIAN.description:
An example of what is known as a
“form change”. Tornadus has been
sighted crossing the ocean while in this
form.

TORNADUS_INCARNATE.description:
Tornadus expels massive energy from
its tail, causing severe storms.
Its power can blow entire houses away.
It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

THUNDURUS_THERIAN.description:
It pulverizes foes into nothingness
with showers of devastatingly
powerful lightning bolts launched
from the string of orbs on its tail.

THUNDURUS_INCARNATE.description:
The spikes on its tail discharge immense
bolts of lightning. Countless charred
remains mar the landscape of places
through which Thundurus has passed.

RESHIRAM.description:
This Pokémon appears in legends. It
sends flames into the air from its tail,
burning up everything around it. It helps
those who want to build a world of truth.

ZEKROM.description:
This legendary Pokémon can scorch the
world with lightning. It has a generator
that creates electricity in its tail. It
assists those with strong ideals.

LANDORUS_THERIAN.description:
Landorus soars through the sky in
this form, bestowing plentiful
harvests upon the land and earning the
people's reverence.

LANDORUS_INCARNATE.description:
The energy that comes pouring from its
tail increases the nutrition in the soil,
granting bountiful crops. It has been
hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”

KYUREM.description:
This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a
hero to fill in the missing parts of its
body with truth or ideals. Its body became
frozen when its energy leaked out.

WHITE.description:
The sameness of Reshiram's and
Kyurem's genes allowed Kyurem to
absorb Reshiram. Kyurem can now use the
power of both fire and ice.

BLACK.description:
The sameness of Zekrom's and
Kyurem's genes allowed Kyurem to absorb
Zekrom. Kyurem can now use the
power of both electricity and ice.

KELDEO_ORDINARY.description:
When it is resolute, its body fills with
power and it becomes swifter. It crosses
the world, running over the surfaces of
oceans and rivers.

KELDEO_RESOLUTE.description:
The power that lay hidden in its
body now covers its horn, turning it
into a sword that can slice through
anything.

MELOETTA_ARIA.description:
The melodies sung by Meloetta have the
power to make Pokémon that hear them
happy or sad. Many famous songs have been
inspired by the tunes that Meloetta plays.

MELOETTA_PIROUETTE.description: Meloetta's melodies are sung with\na special vocalization method that can\ncontrol the feelings of those who hear it.
